pros: 1. Big corporate company but feels like a family 2. They promote within, if you work hard and efficient, you will likely be up for a promotion 3. Strong leadership on top, great business model
cons: Company is still growing which means there is usually more work than people hired

title: Best job !!!
pros: They care about their employmees! Main reason, they arent greedy and allow you to overtime if needed. During this covid situation they cared about our health im super happy with my job!
cons: I dont have any downsides, they truly gave us so much training and alot of great people work there too

title: Great salary and good work environment
pros: - Very competitive starting salary - Casual attire at all offices starting in 2020 - PTO starts at three weeks - Pretty good work/life balance but sometimes you have to be proactive about setting that balance yourself.
cons: - Very siloed work streams so you don't learn much outside of your specific duties - The gears turn very slowly on raises and promotions

title: Home Loan Specialist I
pros: The money was great and all of my coworkers were very friendly
cons: Everything from managers to policies and especially the non existent loan officers. Little room for growth and always piling work onto people with no extra pay. Will definitely take a toll on your mental and the work-life balance is awful

title: Great Company to Work For!
pros: Career Development Opportunities, Structure and Order, Stability, Diversity, Lots of Support and Flexibility Working Remotely, Corporate Values and Reputation, Open to Changes for making a Difference
cons: Out of my past employers, this has been, by far, the most rewarding career. I have zero cons working for PennyMac. You do not feel like a number at this company. Everyone feels appreciated.

title: Good money, but not sustainable for everyone
pros: As long as you hit your daily sales goals (e.g., getting the required minimum # of locks each day), then you can earn a lot of $ in this role.
cons: Be prepared that the Loan Officer role at PennyMac is truly a sales job, first and foremost. Management takes an aggressive approach and pushes everyone for more sales every day.

title: Great Place to Learn (High Volume)
pros: Opportunity to learn and grow. Working 6 months at PennyMac is like working 1.5 years elsewhere. High earning potential on portfolio customers.
cons: Tier pay is low compared to other companies. Other companies pay 75-100+ BPS per transaction (less volume, but higher pay per funding). High turnover

title: Worst Job Ever
pros: Some nice co-workers trying to brighten up the day.
cons: No training, constant over-time, no work life balance. Nepotism is rampant. It's like working in a Third World sweatshop.

title: Don't make the same assumptions...
pros: Great cafeteria, friendly co-workers.
cons: Where to start, you will not be compensated according to your experience, merit or knowledge. Growth possibilities are non-existent. In the rare occasion that you are granted a raise, it will take 6 months to approve and will be a gradual increase over a 6 month period. Health insurance is ridiculously expensive. I could go on, but ensure you address these concerns during your interview.

title: Excellent, Fast Growing Company provides opportunity
pros: Experienced executives who know what they are doing, great people at all levels, lots of opportunity if you are patient and willing to work hard.
cons: Benefits could be better but are improving every year.

title: Great people, great opportunities
pros: Great work-life balance, opportunities for advancement are given to those that work hard and show potential. Management is always looking for feedback to improve. Human resources has always been quick to help when needed.
cons: No management training for new managers, associate level positions are excluded from mentoring and "empowerment" programs.

title: I love my job
pros: Pennymac has a lot of room for growth , the management is one of the best I've wok with thru out my career.
cons: I feel sick time should be spreaded through out the year instead of one lump sum

title: Very Good Place to Work
pros: Employee Centric, opportunity to move within the company, has handled the Covid pandemic great work from home and offices are as safe as the company can make them.
cons: Pay for performance this is not a negative if you do your job and meet the outlined goals. Company does not just do yearly raises. Vacation and sick time industry standard.

title: Toxic Management
pros: there are no pros, all cons
cons: Steer clear! Such a stale company run like a government agency. Lots of nepotism among the boys club, company will not invest in technology, Loan Officer job is extremely difficult since they run it just like countrywide, and you will get cut if you speak up. Do your homework, talk to existing loan officers, this is not a great company to be successful. The management is threatening if you do not think like them.

title: As with every company, satisfaction is based on your direct manager.
pros: They try to have a fun culture, but your role impacts how much of that you will experience. There is an on-site cafeteria.
cons: The benefits and vacation allotments are not great. Only 2 weeks vacation and 6 days of sick time. Benefits seem to be a bit pricey.

title: Horrible experience
pros: At least you get an hour lunch.
cons: We were doing great working from home. Now everyone has to come back in the office. Why?? You have to wear a mask over your face while talking to customers if you’re working in the office. Do you know how muffled that sounds and how uncomfortable that is?? Let people stay working from home! You can’t social distance in the bathrooms and break rooms, they’re too small. Someone is going to spread covid19. Let us stay working from home!!

title: Smartest, wisest leadership I have worked for
pros: Quality and so far endless inbound calls, wise management, quality co-workers.
cons: This is the best mortgage company I have worked for, and they continue to improve.

title: The Worst
pros: Able to still work during Covid 19
cons: Pay is extremely low HR is not helpful they partner with management HR will go against concerns you have to fullfill own agenda Excessive Calls Will force you to work additional job roles that should be promotional but arent Management will belittle you Management will make you feel less than worth Customer service is extremely micromanaged No room for movement if wanting increase Run far away from Customer SERvice department

title: Great people, great company
pros: Work life balance is great and the dress code is extremely relaxed. Starting pay for Analyst fresh out of college is 55k which isn’t the best but impressive for North Carolina.
cons: Needs more remote options for people outside of senior management. Most tasks within projects can be done anywhere,

title: Overworked, underpaid and no structure
pros: We all struggle together. Thats about it.poor pay, but you won't lose your job since everyone leaves. They'll need you.
cons: Poor leadership, no growth path for hourly employees, poor salary, no training. Youre on your own.

title: beware of the positive reviews
pros: pay checks clear on time
cons: Do not believe any of the positive reviews as management has been encouraged to add positive reviews. This is NOT a good place to work. No Raises but they still do annual review just to tear down employees. Bonuses are promised but stolen away per company policy. Overtime is demanded on the same day as you are expected to work it. No advancement unless former Countrywide or Bank of America crony. Benefits too expensive and just average.

title: BEST Place to work
pros: Both your peers and your management consistently provide assistance and encouragement. All the tools needed for your success are readily accessible. You've read about companies that actually care about you as both an employee and a person. Well, here it is.
cons: Would having everyone being too helpful be a con?

title: Give and take
pros: Best management group in the industry in terms of knowledge, innovative and always looking for business challenges
cons: Compensation is based on contribution but once you contribute your compensation always lags behind. It ends up being a better position to leave and come back to get more money than try to grow within the company because of the compensation guardrail.

title: Purchase loan processor
pros: Coworkers are generally great to work with. Benefits are decent
cons: Management doesn't address issues Unfair treatment within the teams Only concern is adherence. Doesn't matter how well you are doing on funding loans or satisfying the customer.

title: Disloyal, Cheap, Terrible Leadership
pros: Can get hired with no experience
cons: 1. No Training 2. No Diversity in leadership 3. Sweatshop (that's why they have laid off hundreds of Americans and choose to keep hundreds of non american's in their place). 4. No opportunity to advance unless you are in the "favored" offices 5. No pay raises no matter how hard you work 6. Unorganized 7. Hiring associates with little to NO mortgage experience so takes too long to process a refinance and purchase. 8. Terrible leadership, condescending, no compassion 9. Expensive benefits 10. Little pay

title: Great place to start
pros: Great Environment ,Great Team Members, free coffee, on occasion free food, clean building and great security. I loved the fact that this company offered work from home during the pandemic.
cons: Paid time off Pay rate

title: PennyMac Job review
pros: Great management structure. Great work-life balance. Pay is determined on your effort. Random surprise home delivered care packages. Plenty of opportunity for advancement. Great environment of team work
cons: None at this point (90 day)

title: Greatness in the making
pros: PennyMac has a great training team which is extremely transparent and patient. Time to adapt in this environment comes with trial and error. More mistakes you make the better you become with the personal 1/1 training as well.
cons: No cons when you are taught and hardworking.

title: Mentally exhausting
pros: Pay is decent, Overtime always available, hour lunches, & 6 days of sick time once tenured for 1 year
cons: Management sucks which makes the job very stressful.

title: Good entry job
pros: Pretty easy tasks, easy to move up if you work smart & hard, they still try to create a nice company vibe even though we're still virtual.
cons: Training wasn't the best, we worked with the same department but in different locations/states and sometimes there was miscommunication in how to go about things.

title: Amazing Growth Opportunity
pros: Highly competitive pay and lot's of opportunity to grow within the company. Training is solid with plenty of tools available to be successful. PennyMac has an outstanding foundation built for success.
cons: Downside is minimal and I don't have any objections.

title: Revolving door
pros: -Once you're trained, the job is fairly easy. -working from home (although they're trying to reinforce returning to the office)
cons: -revolving door of hiring then firing employees -they hire pretty much anybody so your coworkers are probably not the brightest bulbs in the box. -constant changes in procedures, everyone does their own thing and doesn't get corrected until months down the line

title: Call center only
pros: They did offer a lot of overtime and a paid lunch with free meal if you did a 30 over the hour lunch. So that was a plus
cons: Micro management, felt like a boot camp. Would have talks if they felt you used the bathroom too much. Was impossible to get time off even if you asked months in advance

title: Decent Company
pros: Culture, free lunches and breakfast often, work life balance matters, decent management in Underwriting at least. Training was okay. They offer the opportunity to get involved in culture clubs; they are active in the community. I liked working here.
cons: A little conservative with pay, hesitant to commit to a true work from home model or even a hybrid model.

title: Not much room for growth
pros: There is a cafeteria, a gym, and they have a lot of company sponsored events for employees throughout the year
cons: Totalitarian environment. Micromanaged everything... the CEO had a mentality that if he pays you, you do what he says period. No room for discussion. I am an employee and yes I am supposed to take orders but I think as a leader you have to care about how your subordinates feel and what would make them the best employees.

title: When the economy is good, the job is good
pros: So this job is a decent job to have. The office environment is quiet and the culture is decent.
cons: If the economy is bad job security for certain roles is non existent. They have had three big layoffs so far this year, yet they are hiring new employees. It’s confusing lol.

title: I love working for pennymac
pros: I love the employee recognition. The ability to grow and advance. I love the facility, the gym and full service cafeteria.
cons: There are no downsides working at PennyMac and I hope in the future more people can have the opportunity to enjoy this great company.

title: Do your homework on this company
pros: Worked with a great team.
cons: Benefits are not comparable to market. No advancement opportunities. Culture is not conducive to growth.

title: So-so go to where you are paid well and appreciated.
pros: The people you work with Weekends COVID relief plans and sent people home quick
cons: High turnover No annual raises Low PTO Leadership cannot lead lagging in the tech field Bonus structure is LAUGHABLE

title: NEGOTIATE YOUR PAY!
pros: Great culture. Great people. Company is focused on growth.
cons: No raises. Company is cheap. They automate and send jobs offshore as much as possible, and do not give raises. Negotiate when you're hired. Even some managers tell their recruits that they won't get raises. It's an unwritten rule. Even having good performance reviews means nothing. Also, nepotism.

title: Decent company and leads
pros: The leads at PennyMac are good by comparison at most other companies. Every call was an inbound transfer, no outbounds or cold calls for agents at all which is rare to find at any mortgage company.
cons: Trade-off for the great leads is a pretty miserable comp plan, that they frequently tweak always to your detriment.

title: Not the best
pros: +Consistent Schedule +Remote position +Pay is OK, but you will not get a raise
cons: istent Schedule +Remote position +Pay is OK, but you will not get a raise

title: Would not mind working here again just for a different department
pros: Pay is decent. nice office building
cons: the ratio for the loan processors, closers, funders and underwriters here is off. would not recommend this job for someone with a family that you enjoy spending time with. pay is not worth the un-healthy stress environment

title: Really like it so far
pros: Management is easy to work for, they never micro manage and are very understanding when ever any issues come up whether work related or personal. Our team gets along great and everyone is very supportive of each other. Penny Pantry has really good food most of the time!
cons: The office gets really cold sometimes

title: Great Company
pros: PennyMac is a Stable Growing established Company. I speak for my Division that I work with an exceptional Manager whom cares for her team and if you are a dedicated employee you will thrive and Grow. There is always new opportunites to grow within the company and learn.
cons: There is no negative feedback from me

title: Hard Work is Rewarded
pros: Inclusive company culture, opportunity for career growth, great management, wide variety of job opportunities, subsidized meals in the office
cons: Department subcultures, general culture of urgency and tight deadlines

title: Horrible Mortgage Company
pros: A steady paycheck but even that takes pulling teeth every month to achieve
cons: -non sense metrics that keep you from selling -micromanagement Retail Control Tower environment -antiquated systems that make selling home loans take forever -horrible processing that takes 90+ days -cancel loans culture with no customer regard -Horrible management that retaliates. They will not inform you of policies and will apply them when they are done with you. -encourage LOs to work off the clock to avoid overtime to achieve metrics -worthless HR that only has company’s back -terrible benefits

title: Game changer
pros: Opportunity to make great money. Management is very supportive and is always giving a helping hand. Open door policy and great work environment.
cons: Long hours can consume you if you don't find a balance.

title: Typical
pros: Location. One site café/cafeteria. On-site gym. EV charging stations. Wellness program. Diversity.
cons: Non-competitive compensation. No raises, or rare. No 40(k) contributions for the first year. Computer systems continually fail. Mandatory overtime. Extreme micro managers.

title: Culture
pros: If you are looking to be defend by what you do this is the place for you.
cons: Expectation is for work to take precedent over anything and everything in your life. Management and company is not agile enough to keep up with the markets ebbs and flows.

title: Loan Officer
pros: As a loan servicer, Pennymac provides Loan Officers with plenty of leads and system access to easily be successful. Managers are very helpful as well as peers.
cons: Schedule adherence is very strict. Very little time off is available. Managers often request "Mandatory OT" or to come in during weekends and holidays.

title: Good company with Potential
pros: What I enjoy most about this organization is that it is a growing company with great potential!
cons: Compensation and vacation can be better. Little perks for their employees

title: Poor time management and unrealistic deadlines
pros: Growing company Opportunity to learn Expanding tech stack
cons: Unrealistic expectations to work both day and later at night Long never ending meeting No time management Poor management Low pay

title: An easy-going workplace
pros: For developers, it is a fairly easy-going work place. Most people (definitely not all) are kind and managers are flexible.
cons: I'm told by my colleagues that the only time you get a raise is when you get promoted. Which means, every year you don't get a raise, you're actually making less due to inflation!

title: Well Run Company but...
pros: Excellent upper management, forward thinking and strategic in how they move forward with changing markets. Positive, can do attitudes, and good in office atmosphere.
cons: The expectations for production are astronomical, and require excessive overtime in order to achieve for most people. If you need work life balance, this is not a good fit.

title: Great energy!
pros: -Super fun place to work, the days fly bye -Very helpful peers, especially for someone with no prior mortgage experience -Great pay structure, 20k a month is consistently wachievable with effort
cons: - OT is not required, but can be needed to hit the bonus performance multipliers - One Saturday a month required

title: Ok - but needs improvement
pros: If you would like to move departments, they are very helpful in assisting you. Management is great.
cons: No raises, they are rushed to train you, they expect you to pick up on certain tasks with no training, heavy work load, no extra pay to train new team members.

title: Ok overall
pros: Work life balance is good, people overall are very nice.
cons: Requiring return to the office. Really missed the boat not transitioning to remote permanently for as many people as possible, and cutting down on facilities expenses. No yearly raises, not even COLA.

title: Realistic & Fair
pros: PennyMac has met beyond my expectations. I appreciate the company’s culture and how respectful and supportive superiors are towards their employees. I continue to enjoy my journey here and look forward to contributing to the success of the company.
cons: The temperature in the facility is too cold.

title: Mixed Bag
pros: Can be good if your own local eco system
cons: Politics and thick; annual raises are not policy, though they happen for those that are liked; vacation days are few, and not PTO so separate vacation vs sick buckets. 401k not allowed to invest in for whole 1st year. complicated stock option system.

title: Interesting, Educational
pros: None , the only would be that the company is still new enough to gain a position or create one
cons: Too many to name. I can only speak of the department that I'm in, but there is no support, growth or encouragement

title: Micromanage is an understatement
pros: Daily specials at the cafeteria. Opportunity to grow if you can make it the full year... Remember... its a call center...
cons: They have a watch tower in the middle of the call center to monitor everyone and make sure everyone is taking calls and at your desk. If you are off a phone call for more than 6 minutes, the tower will radio a supervisor to check up on you.Relationships carry more weight than performance.

title: Customer service
pros: PennyMac has amazing team leaders is customer service. James is my team leader and he is the most helpful manager I've ever had. He definitely puts the customers best interest first.
cons: To my knowledge there is no cons I've seen for PennyMac.

title: Home Loan Specialist
pros: None except for the people you work with are nice.
cons: This place does not know reality and how to tell the truth, and don't believe the 4 and 5 star ratings.

title: Underwriter
pros: The Bonus structure/over time options
cons: They give you a positive review and then lay you off 3 weeks later with NO SEVERANCE and your insurance ends on the last day of employment. Also, lets also add this is just 24 days before Christmas!!

title: If I could give half star...I would
pros: work schedule flexible when needed, they offer free coffee and tea
cons: no raises, unprofessional management, unorganized organization from management to training to HR. only way to advance is if you have history with upper management (good old boy network), certainly not by qualifications nor merit

title: Company Review
pros: PennyMac show compassion for the employee's, also the company encourages growth.
cons: etter health benefit packages and being closed for more holidays. Considering the fast pace and changing environment observing more holidays is helpful.

title: Culture is good
pros: Good Culture Nice office environment Great people to work with Newer-so ability to contribute is high
cons: Lower pay location of office not great

title: Things Have Taken a Turn...
pros: You will have the opportunity to work with some great people that will go out of their way to help you.
cons: The amount of stress, expectations, little understanding offered, and belittling you will encounter working in the nature of the company are not worth the compensation and poor benefits.

title: Horrible. I was so excited to work here and it all went away the moment I started.
pros: None at all that I can say positive. Its horrible
cons: There is no training at all. So much favoritism is ridiculous.. They will hire you, ignore you when u need help and quickly fire you. This company has poor morale and very high school atmosphere. Please rethink working here.

title: Manager
pros: Great manager and team, cafeteria offers good food and weekly variety, and there are promotional opportunities if you work hard
cons: Location could be better, great 401K but have to wait a year to get matching funds, benefits are good but vacation time could be better

title: Its what you make of it
pros: Promotions. Flexible scheduling. Room to grow.
cons: Low wages. If you are promoted you will have to fight for a raise. The raise will be a max 6 percent if you get it. It's no worse than any mortgage company out ther.

title: Loan Services - Research
pros: Inclusivity of employees is a priority at PennyMac, through care packages and hosted events, employees are meant to feel at home and/or happy to work for this company. Adequate training and supervision is also heavily emphasized as to ensure high performance across the board.
cons: The offered benefits could be better

title: Very Stressful
pros: Inbound calls from current customers, so warm calls.
cons: A constant drum beat of taking applications to move on to the next one. Very stressful.

title: Great Talk terrible delivery
pros: decent pay and very low workload
cons: Terrible management Liars not reliable They sell you into this idea that the company is great and pull the rug from under you in the next opportunity we were told our jobs were safe and two weeks later we were laid off just terrible way of treating your employees. Our manager didn't even have the guts to call us and tell us we were laid off he had HR do it for him.

pros: Penny Pantry, nice facilities, generous hybrid schedule, decent pay and benefits
cons: Industry outlook is bleak at the moment, coworkers/employees are either indifferent or compete with each other in some departments, management is hit or miss in quality.

title: Conservative environment with weak benefits
pros: Many excellent people working here - committed, intelligent, experienced. Onsite cafeteria is a huge perk.
cons: ervative environment with weak benefits

title: enjoy my job
pros: i like the people i work with. Don't have superiors mirco-managing us. Great food at the Pantry. I don't mind coming into work everyday because of the atmosphere. Good work/life balance.
cons: parking is pretty bad if you get here later than 8, but other than that, don't have any complaints

title: The food is decent
pros: Great place to gain experience and put on your resumè to get a higher paying job. They have a cafeteria with healthy options and reasonable pricing.
cons: No standard raises and very few promotions. It would be nice to have your hard work acknowledged every once in a while.

title: If you want to work with great people but don't care how much you make.
pros: All the people I worked with would have to be the best part about this company.
cons: Compensation is horrible. Especially for those who work hard and move up.

title: Great place to work!!
pros: Great environment, doubled my income. 90% inbound calls are portfolio leads so customers already know who we are. Promoted to management in a short time, work hard and you will move up.
cons: Overtime required sometimes but not a big deal, normal day 8 hours.

title: PennyMac is truly a great place to work.
pros: All of my coworkers have been extremely friendly and helpful during and after my training. Plenty of hours available, especially the opportunity for overtime work. Will always keep me busy.
cons: It is a slightly tough transition coming out of college, but just takes some time to adjust.

title: Great company, not for everyone
pros: Income Work from home Leads provided Good people Plenty of resources
cons: Micromanagement. Call volume is slowing down Lack of leadership. Plenty of managers, very few leaders.

title: Decent place to work
pros: Lots of growth potential, good benefits, great managers, decent pay for entry level positions, lots of OT available
cons: Very corporate setting, not much work life balance offered, training is not done well at all, your position just feels like you are an assembly line worker

title: Good pay and good people
pros: Ability to earn really good money on commission; management is willing to help out with generous lender credit; overall friendly culture and ability to progress quickly
cons: Long hours are expected, but it's a sales job so to be expected

title: The best place I have ever worked!
pros: Everyone I have worked with and met from other departments is kind and dedicated. The company is still small enough that you can make a difference.
cons: Benefits could be better...but are improving!

title: Preferred over 4 other companies in the same industry
pros: Working with good people. Management listens to issues and address them. Pay is competitive. Good location to find a home in the area.
cons: Can be difficult to move to other departments.

title: Great Company that cares about their employees
pros: Free lunch, care packages from covid, remote option, great rates and ability to match and beat competition.
cons: They changed the funding units for top tier, the leads are very hard to convert. Can only take up to 7 calls a day without credit pulls.

title: Good for minimal experience
pros: Great team members Great for people who just graduated from college and need work experience. A great place to learn the mortgage business.
cons: You don't get a raise for starting a more difficult role that isn't a manager position. Bonus is quarterly instead of monthly. Employees not compensated as much as other mortgage businesses.

title: Honest Opinion
pros: This is a great company to start your career and learn the basics.
cons: You will not be offered a raise even if you meet/exceed standards & yearly quotas. They will literally force you to attend a meeting to advise how much money the company earned but in the same breath tell you they are not offering raises.

title: Underpaid / No room for growth
pros: - Paid Family leave - College compensation - Medical Dental - 401k
cons: - Raises are hardly given - No room for growth - CEO stated that compensation adjustment for inflation or cost of living is ridiculous. - They track your time online and mouse clicks.

title: Processor
pros: Vacation Requests Paid Vacation/Sick Leave Always work
cons: No Promotions Lateral movement No Cost of Living Adjustments No Raises High Deductible

title: Home Loan Specialist
pros: Co workers, OT, decent benefits, some holidays off
cons: mandatory OT, weekends, low pay, extra work with no raise, no promotions, upper management not involved, micromanaging, toxic environment, bad training

title: It was great until..... we were all laid off.
pros: The culture was great. Family like atmosphere.
cons: Mass layoffs at the drop of a hat. I saw two in the short 5 years I was there. Thankfully the first wave didn't impact my department. However in 2022 they closed down operations in northern CA.

title: Life at PennyMac
pros: Good first job out of college, learn new skills quickly
cons: Not much growth, not pushed to excel beyond your basic responsibilities, company culture is horrible

title: PennyMac is an amazing place to work!
pros: There are so many benefits and opportunities for growth. It is also a pleasant place to work because the environment is conducive to everything we are assigned to do.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of.

title: Best Company to work for
pros: Appreciative, Opportunity to Grow, Great VP Leadership
cons: The only con would be the vacation time of 2 weeks a year

title: Working Reward
pros: Working for PennyMac is a Reward every day. At the end of the day I can say I was a part of this great team. I love working with professionals that I can learn from.
cons: The only downside is not getting yearly merit increases for a job well done.

title: Awesome company to work for
pros: Leadership is positive and everyone is happy to be at work and give you opportunities for internal growth.
cons: None at this time. I think many of the positions will become permanently remote and that will be a huge game changer.

title: Pretty good
pros: Very competitive in pricing. Some proceeding teams are amazing. Management is helpful and attentive.
cons: Some processing teams cause grey hairs. Like other institutions, always decreasing pay, and increasing responsibilities over time.

title: Was unaware PennyMac was in Nashville
pros: New site, new Division, Advancement Opportunity into sales management roles here at Nashville site in NCA. Provide base pay/commission/ramp up bonus/benefits and inbound leads daily.
cons: Many interviews to get to a written offer.

title: Not terrible but not great
pros: The managers are good people who want to help.
cons: Outdated systems. Upper management doesn't take much into consideration. Bonus structure too low for the work done

pros: The pay was decent for a entry level position. The schedule is flexible, you can pretty much clock in anytime you want as long as you do a full 8 hr shift.
cons: The cons are management. Only really 2 good managers that you’d be lucky to have. Miscommunication is a huge thing. Unrealistic goals

title: Worst Company Ever for Advancement and Pay
pros: No Longer There Nothing Else
cons: Micromanaging Dishonest Cheap Lack of Strategy Toxic Management

title: Manager
pros: Growing company, very specialized and experienced leadership, solid outlook. New benefits programs being launched.
cons: Everyone across industries is having to do more with less. This can be a challenge but also an opportunity for cross-team collaboration and personal growth.

pros: Fantastic place to work! If you want to work hard and do the right thing; you can certainly expect to grow into your own career at PennyMac!
cons: None to speak of at this time.

title: Don't trust a word they say or any promises
pros: Remote work, extensive training modules
cons: Sr Management is ineffective. teams are grossly underqualified and no support given once out of training. Managers are spread too thin and Underwriters are on their own.

title: Work Overload
pros: Great manager Flexible schedule Easy systematic process
cons: New changes that were overwhelming difficult to handle pipeline of 90+ Loans New call queue system that has you be available during your shift and still needing to call your loans

title: Great place to get your foot in the door to corporate world.
pros: - Great Training - A lot of help throughout your time there - Decent benefits
cons: - Best place to get stuck for a long time with minimal pay raises - Seems like you're just a number - Pay could be a lot better

title: Intern
pros: In depth look into the mortgage industry and mortgage banking. If you have a good manager, you get to work on hands-on meaningful projects.
cons: compensation is really bad, and depending on which you department you work in, you could end up with very little work or mentorship.

title: Enjoyed my time and wished I stayed longer
pros: Great people, benefits, and solid leadership committed to doing the right thing and growing the Company responsibly.
cons: More HR partnering in the respective LOB's. Accessibility to senior leadership...not really a Con just made my role more challenging.

title: Wouldn't recommend.
pros: They give out good company merchandise.
cons: Management as a whole seem to care more for their California employees and don't really care about their Texas employees. The HR in Texas takes the side of management and really isn't there for the employees at all.

title: Company Review
pros: - Growing Company - Good world culture - Inclusive and encouraging team - Various Projects to work on for PBT side - 401k matched options
cons: - Slightly below par starting pay package, depending on role, have to negotiate well - Long work hours

title: Love Everything
pros: Many opportunities for career development. Excellent management. Diversity and Inclusion focused. Compensated well for a job well done. Great benefits.
cons: Working from home has been bittersweet as it's always a good experience to be in the office.

title: Excellent company with high income potential
pros: Base salary with Inbound leads that result in a high commission structure that yields $500 per closing. Average 30-40 closings after 6 months
cons: Training could use more structure and systems are outdated, but they are working on improving their software.

title: You're a just a number
pros: If you know people from Countrywide or Bank of America you're in good company.
cons: They only care about the bottom line. They do not value their employees and will use them a scapegoats.

title: Genuinely enjoy working here
pros: The best reason to work at Pennymac is the culture.
cons: The downside of working at Pennymac is their salaries might not be as competitive as other places, but the culture is so great that you might stick around anyway. It's not always about the money.

title: It's a job that pays money
pros: They pay with money It's a large mostly stable company My paychecks always clear
cons: Micro management More FVPs and SVPs then you can shake a stick at Micro soloing of just about everything Super territorial deparments and managers Consistantly inconsistent direction from management

title: High Growth, Good place to work
pros: I have been working at PennyMac full-time for less than a year I love the culture at PennyMac as it’s one of the reasons we continue to grow at such a rapid and consistent rate.
cons: Hard to find Parking on Agoura Hills Location

title: Don't Tell
pros: Not going to tell because I don't want everyone to find out how great it is here at PennyMac. The hoards will com and take our jobs. Just kidding..
cons: Google Mail may not be as productive as Outlook.

title: Good Company Culture
pros: BOD made good efforts to ensure inclusivity and uphold company standards and employee morale with company-wide meetings, prizes and perks.
cons: Though company tried to maintain good culture with room for employees to grow, there was an eminent feeling of lack of trust to produce quality work

title: Wonderful company
pros: This company genuinely values it's employees and I feel it shows.
cons: The only con is I'm not a fan when they convert our hourly lunches to 30 minutes without much warning.

title: Great Remote Work
pros: Remote if you live in the area, good benefits, great team, lots of morale bonuses.
cons: Managers always busy, QC reports are harsh and always on you. Mandatory overtime every other weekend, plus additional hours every Monday, First day and last day of the month.

title: Worst career decision
pros: They will send you gifts such as coffee coasters to make up for the required OT.
cons: Micromanagement and lack of management training. Absolutely no room for growth. They lay people off and the remaining individuals must pick up the slack scratching their head figuring out HOW.

title: More cons than pros
pros: Management is approachable, Growing company
cons: Minimum benefits, Limited Career Advancement, Micro Management all the way through upper management, No Flexibility on the hours or remote work opportunity

title: Business Analyst
pros: Room to grow, learn, make mistakes. Laid back atmosphere.
cons: Management plays favorites. Core values are not shown by Sr. leaders. The less accountable, reliable, and ethical employees get rewarded.

title: A job with a check
pros: Payroll on time bi monthly
cons: Management is horrible. Buddy system in full effect for promotions. No raises! Paid bi- monthly.

title: Love working at PennyMac
pros: PennyMac is an amazing and rapidly growing company that really cares about their employees and provides an inclusive and diversified environment. I am excited to have joined such an awesome company!
cons: At this time, I have no significant cons.

title: Great community
pros: Unity, community, communication, respect, friendly, work from home (currently)
cons: pay on the lower side, not enough educational resources, training needs improvement, frequent change in processing

title: Great Place toWork !
pros: Very supportive management, good pay , lots of growth potential, great co-workers.
cons: Benefits could be more affordable, PTO should be more inline with larger companies, 401k match and sick days don’t kick in until after 1 year.

title: Revolving Door
pros: Good pay with plenty of O/T when the mortgage market was booming. Good Benefits.
cons: Seems the practice is to let the majority of knowledgeable, experienced workers go to bring in newbies. Definitely will take quantity over quality in this revolving door style of managing things.

title: Good Pay, Growing Department
pros: pay is good, atmosphere is laid back, good vibes and people
cons: the department is growing, with that comes growing pains, trying new procedures, trying to see what works, etc.

title: IT Infrastructure Team- Great Place to Learn and Grow
pros: Newest Technology Stacks Great team work environment Good people Challenging Projects and Never boring
cons: Career Path for existing employees unclear Vacation minimal Minimal Telecommute options

title: Work Hard for Career Advancement
pros: If you work hard, you can move up. Promotions are merit based. Full benefits. Managers want you to succeed. compensation is very competitive. Warm leads rained down on you.
cons: a lot of monitoring for many aspects

title: Ridiculous
pros: Great Pay, Very Nice People
cons: I guess you can't ask any questions even if you're a new hire, but everyone else on your team can ask for help and they get the help they need. I witnessed some racial comments myself personally, This team will talk negatively about other people they work for. Oh I've proof!!!!!

title: Great experience
pros: I learned a lot about the mortgage industry working here. I started off in customer service and moved over to their renovation loan department.
cons: Customer service became mundane after a while, many employees and supervisors would leave because of the un realistic expectations set

title: OK, but not great
pros: Very talented group of colleagues. Cohesive, unified drive to succeed. Seems like you can transfer to other roles, but must stay in current role for 9 months minimum.
cons: Lowball on salary and easily 50-60 hour work weeks are expected. Often working evenings and weekends.

title: Decent, room for growth, nothing great
pros: Decent compensation, not competitive but definitely fair Decent office, nothing fancy but definitely decent
cons: Not an exciting place to work Some overly flirty and inappropriate work comments

title: My Glassdoor Review
pros: Extensive training and excellent perks
cons: Antiquated systems could lead to issues down the line.

title: MORTGAGE
pros: Strong problem-solving ability, data collection and analysis. • Resilient with all-encompassing customer service experience. • Excellent computer and data entry skills. Proficient in various software applications. • Skilled in Microsoft Office, Word, and Excel. • Analytical, organized, and dedicated
cons: LAYOFF MONEY FAMILY TIME OFF WHAT A REALESE

title: Best Company I have ever worked for.
pros: Cares about their employees, great management staff, very good at cross training in other departments, always promotes from within, open door policy for managers, very good work/life balance, very transparency
cons: Pay is not comparable to other mortgage companies

title: Good company to work for
pros: Benefit package, technology, supportive leadership
cons: So busy - can't hire fast enough to align with incredible volume, long hours

title: Not a forever job
pros: You can be entry-level and work your way up.
cons: Some of the black people are ignorant and rude. If you are non-black some of them will harass you. Avoid talking about current events- people will jump down your throat for having conservative/unpopular views.

title: Decent company
pros: It’s a big company, but somehow maintains a “small time” feel Casual dress
cons: High egos Desk setup is impersonal and anti-productive Pay is below average Culture

title: Average work-life
pros: If you’re looking for a steady job and open to challenges, this company is for you
cons: Takes time to go “up the ladder” as well as steady monetary increases

title: Good company to work for
pros: I had an opportunity to work on very interesting and business-critical projects. Great colleagues and supportive management.
cons: Salary could be more competitive.

title: Pennymac Employment
pros: The company was forever sending gifts in the mail.
cons: Lacking Work Life Balance and Did Not Annual Raises/Cost of Living Raises. What A Bomber!!!

title: Micromanaging
pros: Employee are cool and helpful. I could stop and ask any employee from any department for assistance and they were very helpful.
cons: Micromanaging was the very annoying. Having to be monitored and everything record everyday was very very bothersome.

title: Great place to start your career
pros: - Great organization culture, friendly people - Excellent manager (for me), strong & helpful team - Decent benefits - Many other pros
cons: - can get busy at times, but not all the time/not too much OT

title: Company Above the Rest
pros: Salary higher than other companies for same position; caring and informed management; working from home(safety first)
cons: Quotas need to be met and overtime is encouraged - Not really cons?

title: Company that offers great stability and growth!
pros: Stability, growth opportunities, open-minded culture, fast-paced, ability to make a difference
cons: Too many layers. Too many meetings attended by too many people in the same functional chain.

title: Literally the Best Company I've ever worked for
pros: Fair and Reasonable management. Pay quarterly Incentives for meeting or passing goals. Excellent work life balance. Great Benefits. Everythi g was perfect for me!
cons: I'd say they could use better management of the systems, to avoid duplication or faulty metrics.

title: Loan Officer Experience
pros: Sales cycle is extremely easy with avenues for assistance in every aspect.
cons: Strong micro management, expected to work weekends and holidays, no desire for employee growth.

title: Micro- Managed
pros: Decent place, but just make sure you don’t take an extra 30 seconds on your break or you’ll hear about it.
cons: Micro managed in every way and overtime is mandatory, although they claim it’s optional.

title: Had a great experience!
pros: PennyMac was a great experience. I learned so much in such a short amount of time and met a ton of great, hard-working people. Good communication and fun culture.
cons: No training or parking at this facility.

title: Average job below average pay
pros: Decently friendly co-workers Cafeteria available with healthy food options
cons: Extremely boring place to work Lots of micromanagement Raises are far and few between You will be underpaid

title: Great time to be in mortgage.
pros: It is a growth company in a dynamic industry and has the most committed leadership team in mortgage. This continues to provide opportunities to learn and grow in my career.
cons: It is a very intense environment.

title: Excellent Culture, Excellent Company
pros: PennyMac provides a positive and productive work environment. It is structured to allow people to work independently on their daily tasks while making sure we are putting borrowers into the best loans possible.
cons: Continue to work and improve technology.

title: PennyMac
pros: I have worked at other loan companies, and none compare to Pennymac. They have a great structure that allows for enormous success for all.
cons: Some would say strict compliance is the only issue here. But that offers integrity with employees and customers

title: Career advancement
pros: Positions are always available within the company, growth within different departments is widely accepted.
cons: Politics - Career advancement/compensation is not based on merit or knowledge.

title: Great place to work
pros: Hand fed leads fast paced Make more than you ever have Integrity at its core Great sales environment Opportunities to promote
cons: You have to work :)

title: Got a call back from this job? RUN!
pros: It's a nice building Free drinks (coffee, energy drinks)
cons: No work/life balance Pay is minimal You can not move up They don't want you leaving your seats They don't care about you and your family issues Role became a call center Expected to manage over 180 loans at once while taking in bound calls from other employees clients Pay was TERRIBLE

title: Laid off
pros: Good team. Nice people. Good Pay
cons: They hired a lot of people recently in the team. And then laid people off. Why were they hiring in the first place?

title: Sad time
pros: People were great, lots of extras giving to team members
cons: Like every other mortgage servicing company they started dumping their onshore associates to save a few dollars hiring offshore. They shared tons of great ideas and where they were leading to company to land good people only to dump them a year later after setting up their offshore staff.

title: Great Place To Work
pros: A lot of mortgage companies have that mentality that you need to work until 11pm every night. PennyMac is great about allowing people to have a great work/life balance.
cons: Up and down with the market. Out of PennyMac's control

title: Very boring job and no room for advancement. Only work here if you are desperate for a job.
pros: Easy work however it is very repetitious. Flexible work hours and paid time off. I can’t really think of any other positives.
cons: Low paying, weird culture, cheap and selfish management. Glorified sweatshop! Management will buy pizza for the floor to try to make it seem like they actually care for their employees.

title: Worst customer service job
pros: They have a great Pantry with amazing cooks
cons: Your vacation time is very limited. If you want the holiday off you have to submit a year before to get approved. There never enough employees to get the vacation you need and deserve . They give you no credit for going out of your way for customers.

title: Love the Company
pros: Work at home. Exposure to assets and parts of the company i would not see in other places
cons: Long Hours in Busy season

title: Decent company. Salary is lower than market, but offers incentives tied to performance for professional roles.
pros: VP and below 15 PTO days per year. 6 sick days after you work here for a year. 4% 401k match.
cons: Middle of the road benefits and salary/compensation.

title: Mixed Bag
pros: Great culture when it comes to social issues and equality. Plenty of opportunities to volunteer and contribute to various charities.
cons: Horrible work-life balance. 10 hour weekdays plus weekend hours are expected. Also, training is haphazard and inconsistent.

title: Just Okay
pros: Consistent paycheck, was allowed to work independently
cons: istent paycheck, was allowed to work independently

title: Work Summary
pros: Good Pay - Remote - Equipment Provided
cons: Extreme Micromanaging - Lack of communication from top to bottom - Mass Layoffs

title: Challenging in good and not so good ways
pros: Interesting and challenging work, good benefits and excellent bonuses
cons: Poor work life balance, tech leadership too beholden to product concerns and fail to advocate for system health where appropriate, immature process management on tech side

title: Network Operations Engineer
pros: -Got to meet department heads & other employees -Smart people -Had a tour of department
cons: -Interviewer was late for the meeting.

title: Satisfied with PennyMac. The growth potential in both responsibility and compensation are slow, but there
pros: Potential to grow career if you plan to put in the time
cons: Compensation growth does not quite follow the growth in responsibility

title: Great Company
pros: Great learning experience and advancement opportunities within PennyMac. Great management and leadership to guide you. Great company to work for. Positive attitude all around.
cons: No cons at this time

title: Recruiter
pros: PennyMac offer a lot of opportunity for internal growth.
cons: I would be nice if PennyMac offered Tuition reimbursement

title: Just a paycheck
pros: Cafeteria is convenient, nut you have to pay it. Occasionally work from home.
cons: No promotion. 2 weeks PTO, 6 sick days. Insurance is high. No HMO option anymore because company pay more for employees.

title: The Mac
pros: Great people to work with. I have a fantastic manager. Everybody seems to get along well with each other
cons: Low pay no opportunity to bonus

title: Great Company to work for!!!
pros: Positive work environment, company provides lunch at 1-2 times a week. Incoming calls with portfolio customers. Company promotes from within. Opportunity to have a career not just another job.
cons: Required to work one Saturday per month.

title: Growing Company with Growing Opportunities
pros: This is a growing company with a clear vision of where it is going and affords its employees the opportunity to grow with the company
cons: The speed of the growth is exciting but can be challenging

title: Discriminatory leadership
pros: If there were any Pro's, there wouldn't be such a high turnover.
cons: If you wish to advance, this is not the place for you. Unless part of the click, you will not go anywhere. Higher ups take pleasure in being demeaning and condescending - especially to minorities. The CEO is aware and promotes those that have been abusive. Complain to HR and you will have a mark against you.

title: Great Company
pros: Great people, high integrity, and they work hard to make the customer happy.
cons: Growing technology which is taking a while to develop, which is typical and understandable.

title: Solid experience low pay
pros: PennyMac offers a lot of opportunities to those on the product side.
cons: Low pay and benefits like 401k don’t begin till being with the company for a year.

title: caution. stay away
pros: Random gifts sent to you via FedEx during the pandemic l.
cons: lack of leadership lack of policy lack of professionalism lack of accountability poor management poor training poor pay poor work-life balance retaliation from senior management high turnover

title: loan officer
pros: management and people very helpful, okay salary if you are performing well
cons: don’t change any standards even with rate changes lot of people not making as much as they need. horrible flexibility when it comes to time off around the holidays.

title: Dont work unless you dont care for work life balance
pros: Good potential for money but their promises are fake
cons: The managers dont care about you they only care about money and numbers

title: Anonymous
pros: 401(k) matching, plenty of work, variety of loan products available to learn (but don't expect to obtain DE/LAPP/SAR), flexible work schedule depending on manager
cons: Minimal advancement opportunities, no raises (even with promotions), poor benefits, mandatory overtime is required over an extended period of time (more than 3 months), micro-managing

title: Great Company
pros: Wonderful place to work! Great people and great training. Would easily go back after I finish academia.
cons: Pay is slightly lower than market, but open to apply for other positions from day 1.

title: Sales
pros: Clear leadership direction and establishment of sales goals. Stable/established/widely recognized platform. Autonomy and decision making ability in the sales role.
cons: High expectations. Complicating corporate structure.

title: I like working for PennyMac !
pros: I like working for PennyMac because of the outstanding management team that continues giving us as much training needed to properly assist our customers
cons: There are no downsides .

title: Work is important, values seem aligned
pros: Upper management seems to appreciate the effort of everyone. Values seem to be in the right place. Friendly, competent peers.
cons: Growing quickly so learning on the fly with not a lot of hand holding.

title: 3 month review
pros: The pay is Good and can get to work from home.
cons: Highly stressful call center, lack of good training, lots of mandatory OT. Micromanaged style environment.

title: Love PNMAC!
pros: Warm, inbound portfolio leads . Super supportive management. Work life balance and culture oriented.
cons: Systems are clunky, but doesn’t hold you back from making money.

title: Good, not great

title: I like it here not sure if I love it yet
pros: Pay is good as well as benefits,

title: Good
pros: Learning and development, company culture, career advancement

title: Don’t work at Pennymac. Toxic environment

title: Avis positif sur cet financier institutionnel.

title: Challenging and Competitive

overflow of information.

pros: You get t work from home and the benefits are great!

title: Don’t work here

pros: There are a few good managers there, that actually care. Just a few.

title: Don't work here if you like a work/life balance
pros: Getting to see great shows.
cons: The Grand Ole Opry still operates like it's 50+ years ago. Half the staff is at retirement age and still drilling old corporate policies that no longer apply today with no interest in new ideas. There is no work/life balance, 50+ hour weeks and still getting work calls on my days off. If you work a 13+ hour show day until 1am you're expected to come into a windowless office the next day for a full 8+ hours instead of resting. There's no work from home policies, and everyone in the office is extremely toxic. The years of bad management and psychology towards one another feeds like a succubus and there's constant finger pointing and snapping instead of solutions. The list goes on, but this company is very good at selling something that isn't true. Worst place I've ever worked at in my entire career. To Collin Reed and all the old men/women in the Ryman hightower, what are you going to do when all the retirement age folks leave, and you can't fill positions because of your outdated policies? You will have a very hard time hiring and will have constant turnover from the younger generations coming in. We are not standing for it, and this is currently happening at the Opry.

Don’t even get me started on the hollow attempts at celebrating diversity!

title: Love working for RHP
pros: RHP is a fantastic place to work. The care, attention, and support of the HR team/upper management to their employees doesn't go unnoticed. They are quick to remedy uneasy situations and look for ways to best accommodate their employees in any given situation. RHP goes above and beyond to make work a place to love to come to (even in a corporate environment) by working hard to create a sense of community amongst its employees.
cons: Sometimes a disconnect between departments. Sometimes a lack of knowing how work flows in working with other departments. Good perks but would love to have the opportunity to buy venue (Ryman, Opry, etc...) tickets at a discount other than service fees.

cons: None, I enjoy my job and the people I work with!

title: Should have taken these other reviews as warning. Single parents, listen up.
pros: The wonderful history within the Ryman and the Grand Ole Opry. Saying that you work for either of them always garners impressive comments from others. But that don't pay the bills. Pay is okay, but not for the amount of unneeded stress you'll endure.
cons: HR department is terrified of communicating with anyone who's not "top-floor". Highly tout "hybrid, flexible workplace" when interviewing, but please don't be fooled. You'll get one day WFH/week at best, and they make you feel bad about it. The corporate office is more cliquey and catty than a teen movie. The amount of bickering that goes on between leadership roles over the dumbest projects and deadlines is laughable. If they'd spend half of the energy expended on that (or the inane team-building exercises you're forced to endure) lord knows what kind of heights this company would be taken to... And it's not like the company is doing terribly - they're rich as balls and like to tell you about it, as if it's also in your bank account as well. "Hey everybody, come see how good I look!" As I said, single parents - listen up. I'm a single father of 2 very young children, and from the day that I was hired, I was up-front in communicating that I needed to make full use of their so-called flex-time and remote policies, as there are times where I have no control over what time I need to leave the office in order to pick up my kids on-time. I was CONSTANTLY bullied by my direct supervisor over this, requesting that I submit my arrival/departure schedule to her WEEKLY for approval, though it never changed. Well, that wasn't going to happen. I was terminated because of this, and it's wrong on so many levels. Mental health is not a concern for leadership or HR. If you disclose you have a problem and need help, they will single you out. Also, get ready for all of the most cliché meme-worthy moments possible in a corporate setting. Pizza parties to celebrate record earnings in Q1! Teambuilding exercises at an escape room. All the gaslighting you can take. Take heed and go elsewhere. This place doesn't have the legacy of any of these historic brands they manage in mind, just how much they can earn. I get it, we're all in business for money, but take care of your people. Lastly - Diversity & Inclusion is touted as a top priority in this organization, but it's laughable. It all comes down to making sure there's a token person of color in all marketing materials, that's about it.

title: Be Ready To Burn Out
pros: Friendships, Ryman staff, experiences, exciting projects, national recognition in terms of venues for resume building
cons: No work-life balance, great employees burn out quickly, frequent restructuring, completely out of touch leadership Corporate leadership is out of touch with their employees and industry standards, and continues to hire executives with no prior music industry experience. I spent many hours explaining to VP level employees how marketing within the concert industry works, which as a professional who would still like to learn, was defeating. The workload assigned and expected from corporate marketing is unmanageable, and when you do express being overwhelmed you'll be told to suck it up. Don't let the shiny factor of the experiences distract you from very toxic culture present. It is not worth it. If you try to defend yourself, you'll be told you're not a "team player." You can do better and deserve to be treated better. You'll have to defend your work each day as your leader won't. Nothing is ever good enough, and then there's the verbal abuse from higher level employees that no one seems to find unacceptable.

title: I Wouldn’t
